intro: Tingulonga nitida, commonly known as the slender tingulonga, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a prominent central column. Tingulonga nitida is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
